Articles.Content:
Hey could you take the time to render this? Shouldn't be too hard.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130451-Dc-3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130451-Dc-3)

> 
> @Endersmens, 
> I know that it's quite silly to ask if procedural parts could be imported (unlikely) but is it possible for anyone to fudge up the mesh of a procedural wing if dimensions were given?
> 
> Hoping to ask for a render of a large circular wing aircraft that I do not want to try building using stock parts for now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Want me to give a try at building it with stock wings? I can't promise that it will fly right, but it should look about right.

> 
> Want me to give a try at building it with stock wings? I can't promise that it will fly right, but it should look about right.

Hey, I could use the help. I got a plan to re-assemble the circular wings with stock parts, by combining the small square panels with the triangular type D ones. 

I'll be releasing the craft file of the Mk. 3 circular wing aircraft shortly today, and will send you a PM when it's out. I may need to wait a while, as the modeller for the custom cockpit is putting the finishing touches to his first mod release sometime today.

> 
> Hey, I could use the help. I got a plan to re-assemble the circular wings with stock parts, by combining the small square panels with the triangular type D ones. 
> I'll be releasing the craft file of the Mk. 3 circular wing aircraft shortly today, and will send you a PM when it's out. I may need to wait a while, as the modeller for the custom cockpit is putting the finishing touches to his first mod release sometime today.

Okay! What should I do?
I mean I can make a circular wing mesh and texture it probably. Just give me the general dimensions and I could probably get it close.

> 
> Ok, a few warnings.
> The importer won't import the new landing gear, so those don't show up. Not much I can do about that. Also, there were a few scaling issues, but I think I fixed them.

Thanks for trying, I am looking forward to seeing it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-15T00:25:50Z" title="08/15/2015 12:25  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 15, 2015</time> by Lego8\_bit**

Ooo OOO, can you do mine pwease?

[http://www./download/ln...SS+Aires.craft](http://www./download/lnbh3433ahdt1g4/SS+Aires.craft)

I can get pics if you need them.

> 
> Ooo OOO, can you do mine pwease?
> [http://www./download/ln...SS+Aires.craft](http://www./download/lnbh3433ahdt1g4/SS+Aires.craft)
> 
> I can get pics if you need them.

Modded or stock? Also pics would be nice. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It is stock...

![I6v3ZN1.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/I6v3ZN1.jpg)

> 
> I tried.... Something's off. I feel like it's the lighting or the proportion of the tank. I added slight shadow to under the guns and the rear and blurred the ground to look like trails.

I took a quick crack at this based on your render in Photoshop this evening and this is what I have.

![Mh8MuHyh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Mh8MuHyh.jpg)
That looks much better than mine!

The main things I did were to put some shadows in there (soft edge shadows to match the cloudy conditions and uneven ground) strong shadowing/occlusion under the vehicle, made the "lit from above" lighting of the barrels stronger, tinted the sides very slightly towards the green/brown of the ground and the sky facing parts a little blue and tweaked the contrast/brightness a bit.

Oh... and added some tracks behind the vehicle which was just some mud from another image cut to the right shape and roughly blended out at the edge.

[KSA MAV from The Martian (No Spoilers)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/135929-KSA-MAV-From-The-Martian-%28No-spoilers%29)
You should call your projects folder StarWIP.

Oh, StarWhip. Do you think *your* render times are long?

Pfft.

![ptz8B.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/ptz8B.jpg) Out of 275 frames. Started at 6:45 am, it is now 7:08 PM, and has 30 hours to go.

I'm just curious, what kind of hardware do you render on, and what do you use to put the KSP models into blender? I've made a few of my own simple models with UV maps, and its quite tedious just for one thing.

this is currently the most advanced thing I've made so far:

> ![KzZZLD.gif](https://j.gifs.com/KzZZLD.gif)

> 
> Oh, StarWhip. Do you think *your* render times are long?
> Pfft.
> 
> [http://i.snag.gy/ptz8B.jpg](http://i.snag.gy/ptz8B.jpg) Out of 275 frames. Started at 6:45 am, it is now 7:08 PM, and has 30 hours to go.
> 
> I'm just curious, what kind of hardware do you render on, and what do you use to put the KSP models into blender? I've made a few of my own simple models with UV maps, and its quite tedious just for one thing.
> 
> this is currently the most advanced thing I've made so far:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> > [https://j.gifs.com/KzZZLD.gif](https://j.gifs.com/KzZZLD.gif)

I use the KSPBlender importer addon, available here: [KSPBlender Release Thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111483-KSPBlender-Blender-addon-for-importing-craft-files)

I have an [Intel i7-4510U CPU](http://ark.intel.com/products/81015/Intel-Core-i7-4510U-Processor-4M-Cache-up-to-3_10-GHz), 2 cores and 4 threads, 2.0 GHz. No GPU.

Starwhip, may i ask, how difficult would it be to remodel fairings in Blender? I have a handful of ships, but many of them use fairings, and esinohio's seems to be inactive. 

Thanks!

- - - Updated - - -

Also, do struts import wonky?
